channel.title: Language on The B0ardside
channel.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
channel.rights: Copyleft (c) 1974 - The Future, Thorsten Sideb0ard; nae rights reserved.

item.title: FORTRAN!
item.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
item.description: Oh shit! this is incredible - IBM engineer walks through the development of a FORTRAN program, including I’m guessing, the first appearance of a GOTO statement! Then, in part two, they have their FORmula TRANslator translate a Fortran program into IBM symbolic language/assembly, and output it to PUNCH CARDS!!. wow..

item.title: Rob Pike, Go Concurrency Patterns
item.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
item.description: I thought I had seen this, but no, it’s just a similar theme to other talks by Rob Pike I’ve seen - this one is quite fun to code along too, its a super neat and compact concurrency app..

item.title: BASIC at 50
item.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
item.description: Now approaching it’s 50th birthday, nice wee video about the origins of BASIC and Time Sharing..

item.title: the biology of code
item.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
item.description:
Fabulous piece and video chat with George Dyson over at the always reliable Edge -

A Universe Of Self-replicating Code | Conversation | Edge.

item.title: Claude Shannon and the Clams
item.author: Thorsten Sideb0ard
item.description:
I finished reading James Gleick's The Information tonite - so good!

Really, the central character is Claude Shannon, who I'm ashamed to admit I didn't previously know much about. Had a quick search when i finished it and found this decent little 30 min documentary which gives a good overview -
